column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Wherein the Angel Locates a Rare Tree and Dines with the Gang
#Text=From afar Freckles saw them coming .
#Text=The Angel was standing , waving her hat .
#Text=He sprang on his wheel and raced , jolting and pounding , down the corduroy to meet them .
#Text=The Bird Woman stopped the horse and the Angel gave him the bit of print paper .
#Text=Freckles leaned the wheel against a tree and took the proof with eager fingers .
#Text=He never before had seen a study from any of his chickens .
#Text=He stood staring .
#Text=When he turned his face toward them it was transfigured with delight .
#Text=“ You see ! ” he exclaimed , and began gazing again .
#Text=“ Oh , me Little Chicken ! ” he cried .
#Text=“ Oh me ilegant Little Chicken !
#Text=I 'd be giving all me money in the bank for you ! ”
#Text=Then he thought of the Angel 's muff and Mrs. Duncan 's hat , and added , “ or at least , all but what I 'm needing bad for something else .
#Text=Would you mind stopping at the cabin a minute and showing this to Mother Duncan ? ” he asked .
#Text=“ Give me that little book in your pocket , ” said the Bird Woman .
#Text=She folded the outer edges of the proof so that it would fit into the book , explaining as she did so its perishable nature in that state .
#Text=Freckles went hurrying ahead , and they arrived in time to see Mrs. Duncan gazing as if awestruck , and to hear her bewildered “ Weel I be drawed on ! ”
#Text=Freckles and the Angel helped the Bird Woman to establish herself for a long day at the mouth of Sleepy Snake Creek .
#Text=Then she sent them away and waited what luck would bring to her .
#Text=“ Now , what shall we do ? ” inquired the Angel , who was a bundle of nerves and energy .
#Text=“ Would you like to go to me room awhile ? ” asked Freckles .
#Text=“ If you do n't care to very much , I 'd rather not , ” said the Angel .
#Text=“ I 'll tell you .
#Text=Let 's go help Mrs. Duncan with dinner and play with the baby .
#Text=I love a nice , clean baby . ”
#Text=They started toward the cabin .
#Text=Every few minutes they stopped to investigate something or to chatter over some natural history wonder .
#Text=The Angel had quick eyes ; she seemed to see everything , but Freckles ' were even quicker ; for life itself had depended on their sharpness ever since the beginning of his work at the swamp .
#Text=They saw it at the same time .
#Text=“ Someone has been making a flagpole , ” said the Angel , running the toe of her shoe around the stump , evidently made that season .
#Text=“ Freckles , what would anyone cut a tree as small as that for ? ”
#Text=“ I do n't know , ” said Freckles .
#Text=“ Well , but I want to know ! ” said the Angel .
#Text=“ No one came away here and cut it for fun .
#Text=They 've taken it away .
#Text=Let 's go back and see if we can see it anywhere around there . ”
#Text=She turned , retraced her footsteps , and began eagerly searching .
#Text=Freckles did the same .
#Text=“ There it is ! ” he exclaimed at last , “ leaning against the trunk of that big maple . ”
#Text=“ Yes , and leaning there has killed a patch of dried bark , ” said the Angel .
#Text=“ See how dried it appears ? ”
#Text=Freckles stared at her .
#Text=“ Angel ! ” he shouted , “ I bet you it 's a marked tree ! ”
#Text=“ Course it is ! ” cried the Angel .
#Text=“ No one would cut that sapling and carry it away there and lean it up for nothing .
#Text=I 'll tell you !
#Text=This is one of Jack 's marked trees .
#Text=He 's climbed up there above anyone 's head , peeled the bark , and cut into the grain enough to be sure .
#Text=Then he 's laid the bark back and fastened it with that pole to mark it .
#Text=You see , there 're a lot of other big maples close around it .
#Text=Can you climb to that place ? ”
#Text=“ Yes , ” said Freckles ; “ if I take off my wading-boots I can . ”
#Text=“ Then take them off , ” said the Angel , “ and do hurry !
#Text=Ca n't you see that I am almost crazy to know if this tree is a marked one ? ”
#Text=When they pushed the sapling over , a piece of bark as big as the crown of Freckles ' hat fell away .
#Text=“ I believe it looks kind of nubby , ” encouraged the Angel , backing away , with her face all screwed into a twist in an effort to intensify her vision .
#Text=Freckles reached the opening , then slid rapidly to the ground .
#Text=He was almost breathless while his eyes were flashing .
#Text=“ The bark 's been cut clean with a knife , the sap scraped away , and a big chip taken out deep .
#Text=The trunk is the twistiest thing you ever saw .
#Text=It 's full of eyes as a bird is of feathers ! ”
#Text=The Angel was dancing and shaking his hand .
#Text=“ Oh , Freckles , ” she cried , “ I 'm so delighted that you found it ! ”
#Text=“ But I did n't , ” said the astonished Freckles .
#Text=“ That tree is n't my find ; it 's yours .
#Text=I forgot it and was going on ; you would n't give up , and kept talking about it , and turned back .
#Text=You found it ! ”
#Text=“ You 'd best be looking after your reputation for truth and veracity , ” said the Angel .
#Text=“ You know you saw that sapling first ! ”
#Text=“ Yes , after you took me back and set me looking for it , ” scoffed Freckles .
#Text=The clear , ringing echo of strongly swung axes came crashing through the Limberlost .
#Text=“ ' Tis the gang ! ” shouted Freckles .
#Text=“ They 're clearing a place to make the camp .
#Text=Let 's go help ! ”
#Text=“ Had n't we better mark that tree again ? ” cautioned the Angel .
#Text=“ It 's away in here .
#Text=There 's such a lot of them , and all so much alike .
#Text=We 'd feel good and green to find it and then lose it . ”
